title: InfraCoalition: A coalition to transform an alternative platform into infrastructure
description:
This module contains our pre-proposal for the OpenScienceNL Infrastructure Call.  

Current research infrastructures in the Netherlands for sharing and publishing are fragmented and often provided by external service providers. We propose a four-year, €1.5 million project to transform an existing, alternative publishing platform into readily deployable open infrastructure for research institutions of any size. In transforming an alternative publishing platform into deployable and sovereign infrastructure, we work towards one seamless, low-cost research environment for discovering, storing, publishing, and evaluating research outputs. Beyond transforming this alternative platform into alternative infrastructure, we extend it to be interoperable between institutions and with the wider social web. Each coalition partner works within their local institution to progressively adapt and enhance this alternative infrastructure to the institution’s needs and the needs of its researchers. 

We transform and extend the alternative open-source publishing platform ResearchEquals. The foundational work (months 1-6) is to recruit staff and build trust within the coalition. The technical implementation happens in two sequential stages: Transformation (months 6-12) and extension (months 12-36). Parallel to the technical implementation, we “scale small” by working with local communities to deploy and adopt the infrastructure (months 6-48). During the entire project (months 0-48), the coalition will meet fortnightly to brainstorm activities, provide updates on local progress, and coordinate efforts to progressively adapt the infrastructure. When successful, this project builds readily reusable, open-source infrastructure run by institutions themselves.

workspace.bio: Assistant prof @ Leiden University, the Netherlands. Researcher, teacher and Open Science Community manager to further responsible research methods and research(er) integrity in Psychology, Neuroscience and beyond. Board chair of the network of Dutch Open Science Communities (OSC-NL); community manager @OSCLeiden. #Meta-science #OpenScience #Replication

Daan Rutten is the Coordinator of Open Science at Tilburg University. He studied Culture Studies at Tilburg University and he obtained his PhD at the department of Modern Dutch Literature at the University of Utrecht. His dissertation concerns the play-element in the modernist literature
of the Dutch writer Willem Frederik Hermans, and the philosophy of Jacques Lacan and Slavoj Zizek. Rutten worked for the Huygens Institute in The Hague as an editor of the collected volumes of Hermans. He is preparing the biography of Jan Romein, and a book on the philosophy of play and politics. With Leon Hanssen, he founded the journal Into the Magic Circle, that will be deployed via Open Journals.

My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.
